meanings.definition: The machinery or mechanical parts of a wheel.
meanings.sent1: The wheelwork of the bicycle includes the gears and pedals.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fixed the wheelwork of the car by replacing the worn-out parts.
meanings.sent3: When the wheelwork of the clock stopped, time seemed to stand still.
meanings.sent4: The intricate wheelwork of the antique clock resembled a tiny city bustling with activity.
meanings.sent5: The smooth operation of the wheelwork ensured the smooth rotation of the wheel.

meanings.definition: The system of gears and mechanisms that make a wheel turn.
meanings.sent1: The intricate wheelwork of the clock kept perfect time.
meanings.sent2: The wheelwork of the old windmill creaked as it turned in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome tinkered with the wheelwork of the watermill, causing it to spin backwards.
meanings.sent4: The wheelwork of the ancient chariot was so well-oiled that it glided silently across the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic clanking of the wheelwork echoed through the workshop as the blacksmith forged a new gear.
